intro: Rondeletia samanensis, commonly known as the golden flame vine, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its striking orange-red flowers that bloom in clusters, making it a popular ornamental plant. It thrives in warm, humid climates and prefers well-drained soil. Its foliage is typically glossy and dark green, adding to its visual appeal in gardens.
